SEARCH
Package com.dua3.utility.options

Record Class Param<T>

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
com.dua3.utility.options.Param<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of the parameter value.
Record Components:
displayName - A human-readable name for the parameter.
description - A detailed description of the parameter.
argName - The name used to identify the argument in a command or configuration.
targetType - The class type of the parameter's value.
converter - A converter used to transform a string array representation of the argument into the specified type.
allowedValues - A list of allowed values for the parameter, limiting what it can accept.
validate - A function used to validate the parameter value. It returns an optional error message if validation fails.
argRepetitions - The allowed repetitions for the argument (e.g., exact, zero, or one).
public record Param<T>(String displayName, String description, String argName, Class<T> targetType, Converter<String[],@Nullable T> converter, List<T> allowedValues, Function<T,Optional<String>> validate, Repetitions argRepetitions) extends Record
Represents a parameter with a set of attributes, behaviors, and validation rules. It provides a way to define parameters of various types with optional constraints, default values, and validation logic. It is generic and accepts a type parameter specifying the type of the parameter value.

  • Constructor Details

    • Param

      public Param(String displayName, String description, String argName, Class<T> targetType, Converter<String,T> converter, List<@Nullable T> allowedValues, Function<T,Optional<String>> validate, Param.Required required)
      Represents a parameter with metadata and validation logic for use in a system.
      Parameters:
      displayName - the name of the parameter to be displayed to users
      description - a brief description of what the parameter is for
      argName - the argument name to be used when passing this parameter
      targetType - the class type of the parameter's expected value
      converter - a converter that transforms string input into the target type
      allowedValues - a list of permissible values for the parameter; can be null if no restrictions apply
      validate - a validation function that checks the parameter value and returns an optional validation error message
      required - specifies if this parameter is mandatory or optional

    • Param

      public Param(String displayName, String description, String argName, Class<T> targetType, Converter<String[],@Nullable T> converter, List<T> allowedValues, Function<T,Optional<String>> validate, Repetitions argRepetitions)
      Creates an instance of a Param record class.
      Parameters:
      displayName - the value for the displayName record component
      description - the value for the description record component
      argName - the value for the argName record component
      targetType - the value for the targetType record component
      converter - the value for the converter record component
      allowedValues - the value for the allowedValues record component
      validate - the value for the validate record component
      argRepetitions - the value for the argRepetitions record component

  • Method Details

    • ofString

      public static Param<String> ofString(String displayName, String description, String argName, Param.Required required)
      Creates a Param<String> instance configured to handle string parameter values.
      Parameters:
      displayName - the name to display for the parameter
      description - a descriptive text explaining the purpose or usage of the parameter
      argName - the name of the argument associated with the parameter
      required - a flag indicating whether the parameter is mandatory or optional
      Returns:
      a Param<String> instance representing the configured string parameter

    • ofString

      public static Param<String> ofString(String displayName, String description, String argName, Param.Required required, Predicate<String> validatPredicate)
      Creates a Param<String> instance configured to handle string parameter values with an additional validation predicate.
      Parameters:
      displayName - the name to display for the parameter
      description - a description explaining the purpose or usage of the parameter
      argName - the name of the argument associated with the parameter
      required - a flag indicating whether the parameter is mandatory or optional
      validatPredicate - a predicate for validating the parameter value
      Returns:
      a Param<String> instance representing the configured string parameter

    • ofUri

      public static Param<URI> ofUri(String displayName, String description, String argName, Param.Required required, Predicate<URI> validatPredicate)
      Creates a new parameter of type URI with the specified properties.
      Parameters:
      displayName - the display name for the parameter
      description - a brief description of the parameter
      argName - the argument name associated with this parameter, used in user inputs
      required - the requirement indicator specifying whether the parameter is mandatory
      validatPredicate - a predicate to validate the provided URI parameter value
      Returns:
      a new instance of Param<URI> configured with the specified properties

    • ofConstants

      public static <T> Param<T> ofConstants(String displayName, String description, String argName, Param.Required required, Class<T> targetType, List<T> allowedValues)
      Creates a parameter instance with a list of predefined constant values.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the parameter's value.
      Parameters:
      displayName - The user-friendly name of the parameter.
      description - A detailed description of the parameter.
      argName - The argument name to be used in external representations, such as CLI or configuration.
      required - Indicates whether the parameter is mandatory.
      targetType - The class type of the allowed parameter values.
      allowedValues - A list of allowed constant values for this parameter.
      Returns:
      A parameter instance with the specified options and constraints.

    • ofConstants

      public static <T> Param<T> ofConstants(String displayName, String description, String argName, Param.Required required, Class<T> targetType, Converter<String,T> converter, List<@Nullable T> allowedValues)
      Creates a parameter that accepts only a predefined set of constant values.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the parameter value
      Parameters:
      displayName - the display name of the parameter
      description - a description of the parameter
      argName - the argument name used for the parameter
      required - indicates whether the parameter is required or optional
      targetType - the class type of the parameter value
      converter - a converter to transform the input string into the target type
      allowedValues - a list of allowed constant values for the parameter
      Returns:
      a new instance of Param<T> initialized with the specified values

    • ofEnum

      public static <T extends Enum<T>> Param<T> ofEnum(String displayName, String description, String argName, Param.Required required, Class<T> targetType)
      Creates a parameter of an enum type with the specified attributes.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the enum
      Parameters:
      displayName - the human-readable name of the parameter
      description - a brief description of the parameter's purpose
      argName - the argument name to be used for the parameter
      required - the requirement status of the parameter
      targetType - the enum class type to which this parameter belongs
      Returns:
      a Param<T> object configured with the specified details

    • ofObject

      public static <T> Param<T> ofObject(String displayName, String description, String argName, Param.Required required, Class<T> targetType, Converter<String,T> converter)
      Creates a new instance of Param for an object parameter.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the parameter's value
      Parameters:
      displayName - the display name of the parameter
      description - a description providing details about the parameter
      argName - the argument name used in command-line or user input
      required - specifies whether the parameter is required
      targetType - the class type of the parameter's value
      converter - the converter used to transform the input string into the target type
      Returns:
      a new instance of Param configured for an object parameter

    • ofStrings

      public static Param<List<String>> ofStrings(String displayName, String description, String argName, Repetitions repetitions)
      Creates a parameter for a list of strings, taking in display name, description, argument name, and repetition rules.
      Parameters:
      displayName - The display name of the parameter.
      description - A description of the parameter.
      argName - The name of the argument.
      repetitions - Specifies the allowed repetition rules for the parameter.
      Returns:
      A parameter representing a list of strings.

    • ofList

      public static <T> Param<List<T>> ofList(String displayName, String description, String argName, Converter<String,T> elementConverter, Repetitions repetitions)
      Creates a Param instance that represents a parameter expecting a list of values with specified validation constraints.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of elements within the list.
      Parameters:
      displayName - The name to display for the parameter in user interfaces or messages.
      description - A textual description of the parameter to explain its purpose.
      argName - The argument name used to represent this parameter.
      elementConverter - A converter that transforms input strings into elements of type T.
      repetitions - A constraint specifying the minimum and maximum number of elements allowed in the list.
      Returns:
      A Param object configured to represent a list of values of type T, with specified constraints.

    • hasAllowedValues

      public boolean hasAllowedValues()
      Determines whether the parameter has a list of allowed values defined.
      Returns:
      true if there are defined allowed values for the parameter; false otherwise

    • getText

      public String getText(T value)
      Converts the given value into a formatted text representation using a default delimiter, open quote, and close quote.
      Parameters:
      value - the value to be formatted and converted into its textual representation
      Returns:
      a string representation of the given value, formatted with default settings

    • getText

      public String getText(T value, String delimiter, String openQuote, String closeQuote)
      Converts the given value into a formatted textual representation using the specified delimiter, open quote, and close quote. The value is split into parts, each wrapped with the specified quotes, and joined using the provided delimiter.
      Parameters:
      value - the value to be formatted and converted into its textual representation
      delimiter - the string used to separate each formatted part of the value
      openQuote - the string used to open quotes around each part of the value
      closeQuote - the string used to close quotes around each part of the value
      Returns:
      a formatted string representation of the given value with the specified delimiter and quotes applied

      public final String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this record class. The representation contains the name of the class, followed by the name and value of each of the record components.

      Returns:
      a string representation of this object

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object).
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:
      o - the object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.
